intro: Athanasia microcephala, commonly known as the dwarf immortality plant, is a succulent species native to South Africa. It belongs to the Aizoaceae family, characterized by its fleshy leaves and ability to store water. The plant features small, rounded leaves that are typically green with a bluish or purplish hue. It produces yellow flowers in the spring, which are clustered in dense inflorescences. Athanasia microcephala is well adapted to arid environments and requires minimal water once established.
